alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Reeves County Plains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 3:37PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Reeves and northeastern Jeff Davis Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 336 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McDonald Observatory, or 15 miles northwest of Fort Davis, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McDonald Observatory, Balmorhea State Park, Buffalo Trail Scout Camp, Black Mountain, Toyahvale and Star Mountain. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 197 and 203. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Reeves County Plains
